item.title: Bring the quiz back?
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:77, topic:424105”][quote author=Tree link=topic=526760.msg3838941#msg3838941 date=1323101636]
I actually wrote most of the questions in that quiz.

We didn’t want members who weren’t capable of finding out answers for themselves. They weren’t private server related either. Just general knowledge. The relevance? So new members would understand that while the information they required was around, it wasn’t going to be spoon fed to them. Also so they would get into the habit of searching for resources on their own.

You could say a google search is basically spoon-feeding anyway. However, it still required a bit of searching and thinking on their part. We didn’t want idiots making accounts one day and then leaving them inactive a few hours later. We were getting so many morons and so much inactivity at one point. The ‘quiz’ system actually improved things.

The whole idea of it is a bit outdated now though, so something new wouldn’t be a terrible idea. An interactive tutorial running users through the basics of what the community is about. The rules. Programming basics. Computer terms. Private servers. Even having it optional would still provide an improvement to our member base.
[/quote]

I agree with parts of this. The original idea didn’t work very effectively then, nor would it now. It’s easier to “mold” people after they join the community, rather than require only certain types of people joining from the get-go.

As for something new, I don’t see why it’s needed. What sort of problems have we experienced in the last few years that require this massive change? The general idea of the quiz isn’t selective. Almost every single member that posted in this topic and voted in the poll would immediately lose access to the website and have to take the new quiz themselves. Some of the suggestions in this topic require massive amounts of effort from the staff (none of which would likely want to devote that much time to something we consider inherently unneeded).

I am unconvinced due to the lack of reasons.[/quote]
But, we still do need something because the increase of uneducated members asking FAQ is becoming disgusting.

Read full topic
